text.text: How do I navigate to the Patient Billing page in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To navigate to the Patient Billing page in ZOLL Billing, follow these steps:

1. Click the "Billing" tab at the top of the screen.
2. Click the "Patient Billing" link in the left-hand navigation bar.

The Patient Billing page will be displayed.

text.text: What are the different tabs available on the Patient Billing page?

text:
The Patient Billing page has the following tabs:
* Active
* Final statement pending
* Final statement sent
* Collections letter sent
* Other suspensions
* Estates
* Payment plans

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of each tab on the Patient Billing page?

text: The "Final statement pending" tab shows a list of patients who are down to the wire - they only have one more scheduled invoice. You may want to use this list to send final notices, call the patient to ask for a payment or to inquire if they received retroactive Medicaid. The "Final statement sent" tab shows accounts that the system automatically suspended because the patient has received the maximum number of statements. The "Collections letter sent" tab shows you the account, number of claims, last statement date, the day you sent the collection letter, and account balance.

text.text: How can I filter data on the Patient Billing page?

text: You can filter data on the Patient Billing page by using the boxes under the column headings to enter a letter or number.

text.text: What options do I have for sorting data on the Patient Billing page?

text: You can sort data on the Patient Billing page by clicking on the column headings.

text.text: How do I review patient accounts on the Patient Billing page?

text: To review a patient account, click the review icon. This will show you the patient's propensity-to-pay, current patient responsibility, running balance, and statement details.

text.text: Where can I change the statement schedule in ZOLL Billing?

text: To change the statement schedule in ZOLL Billing, you can use the following steps: 1. In the navigation bar, click Settings. 2. On the Configuration tab, scroll down to the "Patient billing" section. 3. Click on the days field and select a value from the list. 4. Click the statement field and select a value from the list.

text.text: What information is displayed on the Patient Responsibility tab?

text: The Patient Responsibility tab shows the patient's propensity-to-pay, current patient responsibility, running balance, and statement details.

text.text: What action buttons are available on the Patient Responsibility tab?

text:
The Patient Responsibility tab shows the patient's propensity-to-pay, current patient responsibility, running balance, and statement details. The following action buttons are available on the Patient Responsibility tab:

* View statement: This button allows you to view the patient's statement.
* Send statement: This button allows you to send the patient a statement.
* Create payment plan: This button allows you to create a payment plan for the patient.
* Send collection letter: This button allows you to send a collection letter to the patient.

text.text: How do I move an account to a collection agency in ZOLL Billing?

text: To move an account to collections in Patient Billing, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Move to collections 2. Choose Collection Agency 3. Click Move to collections 4. You will see a message confirming the successful move of the accounts.

text.text: What does it mean to suspend patient billing manually?

text:
When an account is manually suspended, the following things happen:
* ZOLL Billing will no longer generate patient invoices on existing claims associated with this account.
* ZOLL Billing will not generate patient invoices on future claims associated with this account.
* You can continue to post to this account.

text.text: How do I write off an account as bad debt in ZOLL Billing?

text: To write off an account as bad debt in ZOLL Billing, you can use the "Write off as bad debt" option. After you click Confirm, the status for all the claims associated with the account changes to "Closed - Balance resolved". The system shows the write off amount.

text.text: Where can I view the running account balance for a patient in ZOLL Billing?

text: The running account balance for a patient in ZOLL Billing can be viewed on the Patient Responsibility tab. This tab shows the patient's propensity-to-pay, current patient responsibility, running balance, and statement details.

text.text: What information is provided on the Claims in Collections tab?

text: The Claims in Collections tab shows a list of claim numbers associated with this account that have been sent to collections or state debt.

To change the statement schedule, you can use the following steps: 1. In the navigation bar, click Settings. 2. On the Configuration tab, scroll down to the "Patient billing" section. 3. Click on the days field and select a value from the list. 4. Click the statement field and select a value from the list.
